metadata.title: CVE-2023-52852 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: f2fs:compress: fix to avoid use-after-free on dic Call trace:__memcpy+0x128/0x250 f2fs_read_multi_pages+0x940/0xf7cf2fs_mpage_readpages+0x5a8/0x624 f2fs_readahead+0x5c/0x110page_cache_ra_unbounded+0x1b8/0x590 do_sync_mmap_readahead+0x1dc/0x2e4filemap_fault+0x254/0xa8c f2fs_filemap_fault+0x2c/0x104__do_fault+0x7c/0x238 do_handle_mm_fault+0x11bc/0x2d14do_mem_abort+0x3a8/0x1004 el0_da+0x3c/0xa0 el0t_64_sync_handler+0xc4/0xecel0t_64_sync+0x1b4/0x1b8 In f2fs_read_multi_pages(), oncef2fs_decompress_cluster() was called if we hit cached page incompress_inode's cache, dic may be released, it needs break the loop ratherthan continuing it, in order to avoid accessing invalid dic pointer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52852` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic-64k - 6.6.0-14.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-aws - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-azure - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-gcp - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-ibm - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency - 6.6.0-14.14.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency-64k - 6.6.0-14.14.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-oracle - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.7.0-1001-raspi - 6.7.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
